title: Is it 'all throughout' or just 'throughout' or are both alright? - Quora

response.answer_text: alight = all right (usually) The lightning strikes occurred throughout the night. The lightning strikes occurred all throughout the night. I guess the the “all” is just there for emphasis. Consider: I really, really like you. What? Do you need the two “really”s? No. But it drives the point home — emphasis.
Both are acceptable. ““All throughout” is more for emphasis of the duration. However, ““all throughout” is repetition and should be avoided in writing or assessments. 😊
